doc.name: sentenceOffset
doc.summary: Returns the number of sentences between the beginning of a value and an occurrence of a specified string.

example.p: sentenceOffset("This is the second sentence.", tSampleText)
put tReplacement into sentence (sentenceOffset(tOriginal,tReceivedData)) of tReceivedData

description.overview: Use the sentenceOffset function to find which sentence a string occurs in.

parameter.name: stringToFind
parameter.description: The stringToFind is a string or an expression that evaluates to a string.

parameter.name: stringToSearch
parameter.description: The stringToSearch is a string or an expression that evaluates to a string.

parameter.name: sentencesToSkip
parameter.description: The sentencesToSkip is a non-negative integer. If you don't specify how many sentencesToSkip, the sentenceOffset function does not skip any sentences.

description.value: The sentenceOffset function returns a non-negative integer.

comments.p: The value returned by the sentenceOffset function is the number of the sentence where the stringToFind appears in stringToSearch. If the stringToFind is not in stringToSearch, the sentenceOffset function returns zero. If the stringToFind is more than one sentence, the sentenceOffset function always returns zero, even if the stringToFind appears in the stringToSearch.

If you specify how many sentencesToSkip, the sentenceOffset function skips the specified number of sentences in the stringToSearch. The value returned is relative to this starting point instead of the beginning of the stringToSearch.
